item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 30, 2025 at 3:05 AM UTC
item.description:
1. My TV started playing a video in full screen by itself. What happened? (180 points | 76 comments)
2. Buy once, use forever A directory of one-time purchase software. Add yours (178 points | 77 comments)
3. Everyone knows all the apps on your phone (173 points | 72 comments)
4. Towards fearless SIMD, 7 years later (57 points | 11 comments)
5. Atop 2.11 heap problems (103 points | 42 comments)
6. Commercials that David Lynch directed (2018) (98 points | 19 comments)
7. Convert Linux to Windows (85 points | 97 comments)
8. Utah becomes first US state to ban fluoride in its water (93 points | 193 comments)
9. Accessible open textbooks in math-heavy disciplines (161 points | 51 comments)
10. Paged Out #6 is out (187 points | 11 comments)
11. Why Apple's Severance gets edited over remote desktop software (364 points | 237 comments)
12. 6502 as a Service (6 points | 2 comments)
13. Msgpack23 – A modern, header-only C++ library for MessagePack (de)serialization (15 points | 3 comments)
14. XAN: A Modern CSV-Centric Data Manipulation Toolkit for the Terminal (49 points | 8 comments)
15. The disappearance of Gaia, ESA spacecraft will be turned off on 27 March 2025 (58 points | 19 comments)
16. The Mysterious Flow of Fluid in the Brain (9 points | 2 comments)
17. Matrix Calculus (For Machine Learning and Beyond) (77 points | 12 comments)
18. Spark AI (YC W24) is hiring a full-stack engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)
19. Lvgl: Embedded graphics library to create beautiful UIs (82 points | 16 comments)
20. Breaking up with vibe coding (45 points | 25 comments)
21. Gate: AI and Automation Scenario Explorer (4 points | discuss)
22. Veloren – voxel action-adventure role-playing (265 points | 64 comments)
23. Tesla vandals could face 20 years in Salvadorian prison (34 points | 8 comments)
24. A timeline of IBM keyboard history (10 points | 1 comment)
25. Koto Programming Language (143 points | 122 comments)
26. OSS-SEC: Three bypasses of Ubuntu's unprivileged user namespace restrictions (44 points | 8 comments)
27. Vramfs: Vram Based Filesystem for Linux (88 points | 30 comments)
28. Show HN: Physical Pomodoro Timer with ESP32 and e-paper screen (279 points | 63 comments)
29. The Candid Naivety of Geeks (117 points | 59 comments)
30. Real Time Chess – A physical chess board without the concept of turns (205 points | 34 comments)
